channel.title: Tech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from Tech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Could You Use a Rowboat to Walk on the Seafloor Like Jack Sparrow?
item.description: In Pirates of the Caribbean, Jack and Will use an overturned dinghy to hold air underwater. Madness or brilliance?

item.title: The 9 top cybersecurity startups from Disrupt Startup Battlefield
item.description: Here is the full list of the cybersecurity Startup Battlefield 200 selectees, along with a note on what made us select them for the competition.

item.title: Naware’s chemical-free weed killer tech could change how we treat lawns
item.description: A classic hardware startup, Naware set out with a problem -- kill weeds without chemicals -- and relentlessly tinkered until they found a solution.

item.title: Treat yourself: The best smart glasses to buy with your holiday gift money

item.title: What’s ahead for startups and VCs in 2026? Investors weigh in
item.description: VCs share their thoughts on what next year could bring to the market.

item.title: Ricoh GR IV Review: Everyone's Favorite Pocket Camera Gets Better
item.description: Ricoh’s cult-inspiring pocketable camera gets a small update, with important improvements in autofocus and image quality.

item.title: These are the cybersecurity stories we were jealous of in 2025
item.description: The very best reporting and investigative journalism from our friends at other publications.

item.title: As people look for ways to make new friends, here are the apps promising to help
item.description: We've compiled a list of friendship apps, from friend discovery platforms like BFF to event-focused ones like Timeleft.
